definition: (of a newspaper) to stop accepting incoming articles
to cut off (a length)/to stop/to intercept/section/chunk/length

sentences.english: In Moscow, they were minutes away from press time.
sentences.chinese: 莫斯科那头还有几分钟就要截稿了。

sentences.english: Trendstime holds no responsibility for any errors prior to publication.
sentences.chinese: 在截稿日期之前若有错误，本刊概不负责。

sentences.english: In case an order is confirmed 2 weeks before the material deadline, it cannot be cancelled.
sentences.chinese: 截稿日期前两个星期确定的订单不得取消。

sentences.english: The deadline for the new cosmetics packaging design is next Monday.
sentences.chinese: 新化妆品的包装设计截稿日是下星期一。

sentences.english: For once, they did not worry about deadlines and editors.
sentences.chinese: 他们初次可以不消为截稿日期和编纂而懊末路。

sentences.english: How do you cope with deadlines?
sentences.chinese: 你是如何应付截稿日期的？

sentences.english: Chinese News has received no response from Tang as of the time of publication.
sentences.chinese: 但大中报至截稿时止，未曾收到唐的答复。

sentences.english: All Ads should not be changed or canceled after the deadline.
sentences.chinese: 所有广告在截稿期后，不得取消或更改稿件。

sentences.english: Obama's mind reader has crashed his way through yet another deadline.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马的读心者又一次赶过了一个截稿期。

sentences.english: The page has been liked by 2, 625 as of press time.
sentences.chinese: 这个页面在截稿时被2625人喜欢。

sentences.english: Submission guidelines can be found on the World Congress Web site.
sentences.chinese: 截稿日期可以上世界大会网站查询。

sentences.english: In case an order is confirmed within 2 weeks before the material deadline, it cannot be cancelled.
sentences.chinese: 截稿日期前两个星期确定的订单不得取消。

definition: (of a publisher) to send a manuscript off to the printer/(of a journalist) to send a dispatch
to close/to stop/to put a stop to sth/cut-off point/stopping point/deadline
to go to press/to submit for printing
to appear in the news/in the papers
paper/treatise/thesis/CL:篇[pian1]/to discuss a paper or thesis (old)
